The CEO signed your message with an insecure public key. Can you forge their signature using the vulnerable RSA Low-Exponent Signature cipher? Here's the signed message: 0xf44444aa0dc8ab9441077c58b641f16e0cc85e4e55a19fa63920f53acd6c5e70534a9597ef67534c732ceeec8932a9558c0ac9e49983cd09268720ad9a8578e

Public Key (n, e): (11296078506799488445337229268797181850456294471787351727156836317395093650823358448238671007329306181745770484823565093713340751747139528352693090998605209, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{saicnixg}
ciphertext: 0xf44444aa0dc8ab9441077c58b641f16e0cc85e4e55a19fa63920f53acd6c5e70534a9597ef67534c732ceeec8932a9558c0ac9e49983cd09268720ad9a8578e
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (11296078506799488445337229268797181850456294471787351727156836317395093650823358448238671007329306181745770484823565093713340751747139528352693090998605209, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
